Key Match Events: Livingstone and Bethell shared 90 runs off 47 balls to lead England to a Twenty20 series-tying win over Australia.
Livingstone carried them to the brink of victory with a superb 87 off 47, including five sixes and six fours.
Livingstone was bowled with the scores tied and Brydon Carse slogged in the air next ball to give part-timer Short a shock maiden professional five-wicket haul.
Adil Rashid steered to backward point for the single England needed for a three-wicket win with six balls to spare and to tie the series 1-1.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Phil Salt walked into an apparent trap laid by Travis Head, holing out to Matthew Short.
Head, the skipper in the absence of an ill Mitch Marsh, was again electric at the top of the order with 31 off 14 balls.
Jake Fraser-McGurk's 50 — his first international fifty — was followed by Australia plundering 60 from the final five overs to finish on 193-6.
